steps.label: Score & staff setup
steps.desc:
Please encode the basic information about the staff, clef and key of the example. Below you can see the structure skeleton including the score definition <scoreDef> tag, its child element staff group <staffGrp> and its child element staff definition <staffDef>.
The key and time signature are common for the whole score, that’s why you describe them in <scoreDef> regardless of how many staffs are there. You need to use the following attributes of <scoreDef>:
key signature @key.sig – the number of sharps/flats in written key signature, e.g. “1s” for 1 sharp, “2f” for 2 flats, etc.
meter symbol @meter.sym – “common” for common time (C) or “cut” for cut time (C/). In case of numeric time signature you’d use other attributes: @meter.count for the top number of the meter signature and @meter.unit for the bottom number of the meter signature.
Clef is described in the <staffDef> element, because it is related to an individual staff. You need to use the following attributes of <staffDef>:
ordinal number @n – ”1” for the first staff,
@lines – “5” for five-line staff,
@clef.shape – the type of clef: “F”, “C” or “G”,
@clef.line – the staff line on which the clef is placed (counting from the bottom), e.g.: “1”, “2”, “5”.

xpaths.hint: You need two attributes on scoreDef (@key.sig & @meter.sym).
You need a @key.sig attribute, with a value of 3f.
You need an @meter.sym attribute, with a value of cut.
You need four attributes on staffDef (@n, @lines, @clef.shape & @clef.line).
You need a @n attribute, with a value of 1.
You need a @lines attribute, with a value of 5.
You need a @clef.shape attribute, with a value of G.
You need a @clef.line attribute, with a value of 2.

steps.label: Bar
steps.desc: Please encode the empty <measure>. You need to add new child element <measure> to <score> element, after <scoreDef> element. You need to use the numeric designation @n attribute, specifically value “0” for a pickup measure. Remember to provide closing statement to the tag, like in this example: <element attribute=”value”></element>. The measure will be empty and you are going to fill it in the next steps.

xpaths.hint: You need one attribute on measure (@n).
You need a @n attribute, with a value of 0.
